node.text:
Still I rise... On June 19, 1865, US Brigadier General Gordon Granger and his troops landed at Galveston, Texas, confirming the news that the Civil War had ended and that enslaved African Americans were now free. #Juneteenth commemorates this important milestone. Although the ratification of the 13th Amendment in December 1865 ultimately abolished slavery, the struggle for equality continues today. Through the lens of our nation’s iconic places, the National Park Service has a responsibility to advance understanding of our nation’s unique and complex history. We invite you to watch “Twenty & Odd,” which builds on the innumerable contributions of African Americans to the foundation of the nation and explores the trauma, resilience, and beauty of the African American experience.

#FindYourPark #NationalParkService

node.text:
Set against 400 years of suffering, healing, and strength, with a backdrop of our nation’s most storied lands, the innumerable contributions of African Americans to the foundation of the United States are recognized in this short film.

#TwentyandOdd #NationalParkService #AfricanAmericanHistory #FindYourPark #StillIRise

node.title: Twenty & Odd: 400 Years of African American Experience

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Park Service in Joshua Tree National Park. May be an image of one or more people, sky, twilight and nature.

node.text:
“It does not do to leave a live dragon out of your calculations, if you live near him.” – J.R.R. Tolkien⁣
⁣
Just saying. Preparedness is key to a fun, safe trip. Use a trip planning guide to be prepared for your next adventure in a national park. Use the NPS Trip Planning Guide and Checklist to help plan your trip. The guide provides key safety considerations to help you avoid some of the most common mistakes people make when visiting national parks. Find the link in our bio.⁣
⁣
P.S. Just like the unicorns, locations of dragon are not in the brochure. ⁣
⁣
Image: Hikers on rounded rocks in the distance are silhouetted against a colorful sunset sky. Jumbo Rocks Campground at Joshua Tree National Park is a great place to explore the park's bouldered landscape.⁣
⁣
#sunset #joshuatree #california #greatoutdoors #adventure

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Park Service on September 07, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
The Tortugas Harbor Lighthouse is back! Taken down piece by piece in October 2020 and shipped off to Robinson Iron in Alabama for conservation work, the iron-plated lighthouse had been exposed to the elements and the effects of salty ocean air since its construction in 1876. Over its lifetime, the iron had corroded leading to significant deterioration in many areas, particularly around its base.⁣
⁣
The project isn't completely done yet -- additional restoration efforts to the interior and windows will continue on-site. Although the lighthouse and associated bastion will remain closed for several more months, the iconic view of the lighthouse is returning for visitors to enjoy.⁣
⁣
Swipe for a work-in-progress shot and some iconic lighthouse views. ⁣
⁣
NPS Photo 1 by M. Collier: From on top of Fort Jefferson, the lighthouse is visible. The sky is blue with clouds, and the ocean is visible in the background. ⁣
⁣
NPS Photo 2 by Curtis Hall: A work-in-progress shot of the exterior of the lighthouse being put together. Scaffolding surrounds the site, and an employee stands nearby. ⁣
⁣
NPS Photo 3 by M. Collier: A sign on a fence reads "Area Closed." The lighthouse and some of Fort Jefferson are behind the fence. The exterior of the lighthouse is visible, as well as the scaffolding surrounding it.⁣
⁣
NPS Photo 4 by M. Collier: The lighthouse and some of the top parts of Fort Jefferson are silhouetted against the night sky and the Milky Way.⁣
⁣
#DryTortugasNationalPark #DryTortugas #FindYourPark #lighthouse #florida #fortjefferson

Photo by National Park Service in Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park. May be an image of tree and nature.

node.text:
Every national park has a labor history to tell. From the laborers who built the Cheseapeake & Ohio Canal and laid the tracks of the first transcontinental railroad, to the “mill girls” who made cloth in Lowell’s textile factories, to the striking employees of Chicago’s Pullman Company, to the founder of the country's first permanent agricultural union, you’ll find their stories here. Get to work digging into the labor movement’s past at nps.gov/labor
⁣
Image: View of Lock 75 of the C&O Canal. Adjacent to the lock is a two-story log lockhouse. ⁣
⁣
@chesapeakeandohiocanal @lowellnps #laborday #nationalparkservice #canal

location.name: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Park Service in Grand Teton National Park. May be a closeup of deer and nature.

node.text:
When people walk past the “Closed Area” sign…⁣
⁣
When out and about, reduce your risk of injury by staying on trail and avoiding shortcuts. Many outdoor accidents happen when people go off the designated trail or walkway and don’t follow signs or posted information. If something does impact your activity, like a trail being closed, you may be better off turning around than taking a new route.⁣
⁣
Image: Close-up of an elk with a “Really? Hope that works out for them” look. ⁣
⁣
#elk #really #mood #grandtetonnationalpark #nationalparkservice

node.text:
It’s #NationalWildlifeDay!⁣
⁣
National parks offer a unique experience for watching wildlife. But with that privilege comes responsibility. Visitors are responsible for their own safety and for the safety of the animals, too. Simply put, keep your distance—no touching, no feeding, no harassing. Wanna take a picture? Use your zoom and give them room! ⁣
⁣
See more tips to watch wildlife safely by clicking the link in our bio. ⁣
⁣
Image: Infographic with text reading "Wildlife Petting Chart. #KeepWildlifeWild. NPS.gov". Illustration is of a bison with sections of the body labeled "Nope. How fast are you? Vacation over. Think again. Ouch. Umm, no. Do you have insurance?" Text reads "National parks offer a unique experience for watching wildlife. Animals in parks are wild-visitors have the amazing opportunity to view animals as they live and interact with each other in their natural homes. But with that privilege comes responsibility. Visitors are responsible for their own safety and for the safety of the animals, too. Remember to keep your distance, and enjoy your experience watching wildlife. No touching, no feeding, no harassing."⁣
⁣
#RecreateResponsibly #KeepWildlifeWild #wildlife #pettingchart #nationalparkservice

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Park Service in Lake Clark National Park & Preserve. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
What does wilderness mean to you? ⁣
⁣
Wilderness is in the arid deserts, cypress swamps, alpine meadows, sandy beaches, and rocky crags. From Alaska to Florida, wilderness protects some of the most diverse and sensitive habitats in our country. The Wilderness Act of 1964 established the National Wilderness Preservation System, a national network of more than 800 federally designated wilderness areas. Did you know over 80 percent of national park lands are managed as wilderness? During #NationalWildernessMonth, we’ll celebrate federal wilderness areas and the 57th anniversary of the Wilderness Act. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Visit NPS.gov/wilderness to learn more and find ways to visit a wilderness area near you!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Image: A fox stands on a fallen log with snow-peaked mountains in the distance at @lakeclarknps.⁣⁣ NPS/D. Liles
⁣⁣
 #WildernessAct #alaska #lakeclarknationalpark #mountains #wilderness

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Park Service on September 02, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
The hills are alive…with squirrels. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Thanks, @TSA for the mention! Climbing rocks! Not sure about airport pillars. As for you question on best places to climb, national parks offer numerous places to be a little boulder and climb to new heights! From miles of cliff nestled within Kentucky and Tennessee’s @bigsouthforknps to the magnificent pinnacles and towers of Utah’s @canyonlandsnps, visitors can summit a mountain, navigate steep canyons, or challenge themselves on vertical faces of rock or ice. Cool. Be aware that climbing can be dangerous if you’re not prepared. (Kinda obvious. Be safe up there.) Climbers assume responsibility for their personal safety and must have the appropriate skill and equipment for the route, conditions, weather, and season. Always check with a park to find out if they allow climbing and to learn about any park specific rules, regulations, hazards, and closures. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Find more climbing and hiking tips visit www.nps.gov ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Image: Climb every mountain! A golden-mantled ground squirrel climbing on craggy orange rocks on Brokeoff Mountain with Lassen Peak and Mount Diller in the background. The Lassen Peak Trail at @lassennps allows hikers on foot to climb to the summit of one of the largest plug dome volcanoes in the world.  ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#outdooradventures #tsanpscollab #squirrels #nature #mountains

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Park Service on September 02, 2021. May be an image of nature.
Photo by National Park Service on September 02, 2021. May be an image of nature.
Photo by National Park Service in Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site. May be an image of 1 person, animal and outdoors.

node.text:
September just goat serious…⁣🐐
⁣
Do you like to read? Good with kids? Then “Read to a Goat" for National Literacy Month! You herd it here first. Beginning September 1, a red wagon full of books by Carl Sandburg will be available at the entrance to the barnyard and pasture @carlsandburghomenhs. Carl Sandburg loved reading aloud to his family, friends, and audiences (probably some goats) across America. In this spirit, visitors are invited to borrow a book or bring their own, then find a comfortable spot to read aloud to the park’s goats. What if they don’t like my book? Meh! Whatever floats your goat is what we say. ⁣
⁣
The barnyard and pasture are open daily from 10 am to 3 pm. ⁣
⁣
Image: A young boy reads from one of Carl Sandburg’s books. The goat seems amused or possibly about to eat the book. Though it might make the plot easier to digest, avoid feeding the goats your book. ⁣📚
⁣
#goats #carlsandburg #northcarolina #nationalliteracymonth #reading #storytime #goat #bookclub

location.name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

node.text:
Believe it or snot!⁣
⁣
Hellbender salamanders have a lot of weird aliases. Nicknames include snot otter, devil dog, mud-devil, mud dog, grampus, and Allegheny alligator. But don’t call it a mudpuppy. That’s a whole other species. Fun. ⁣
⁣
Adventure slime! Hellbenders are large, aquatic salamanders that can grow over two feet long and weigh more than four pounds. Late August kicks off their mating season, which extends into October. Currently, male Hellbenders are creating rock “nests” in which females will lay their eggs. The males will then fertilize and guard the nest until they hatch, in about two months. ⁣
⁣
I think I’ll stay in. Hellbenders are loyal to their rocks. An individual hellbender’s range is less than half a square mile, and the salamanders have been found under the exact same rocks year after year. Do your part in protecting Hellbenders, and other aquatic species in  parks, by not moving or stacking rocks in streams. ⁣
⁣
Video: All hail the snot otter! A Hellbender seen underwater at @greatsmokynps. NPS/Eric Malone⁣
⁣
#hellbenders #salamander #greatsmokymountainsnationalpark #tennessee #northcarolina #nationalparkservice

node.text:
“Am I a morning person? That would be an enthusiastic yes.” - Colin Robinson⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ ⁣
⁣
Energy a bit drained? Perhaps a beautiful sunrise is what you need? Acadia's landscape (great for daywalkers) features elements that have made Maine's coastline world famous, including rocky shores, crashing waves, tree-lined peaks, and the chance to witness a spectacular sunrise. (Spectacular sunrise not guaranteed; subject to weather, cloud cover, and your ability to get out of bed in time.) If you’re not a morning person, or feel like hanging out in the shadows, perhaps a sunset is more to your taste? ⁣
⁣
Have you ever gotten up early to catch the sunrise in a national park? Maybe you stuck around for a sunset? ⁣
⁣
Video: Time-lapse of sunrise along Ocean Drive. NPS⁣ @acadianps 
⁣
#sunrise #timelapse #acadianationalpark #maine #morningperson

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Park Service in Katmai National Park & Preserve. May be an image of nature and body of water.

node.text:
That awkward moment when you realize the bear is not waving at you, but the bear behind you….⁣
⁣
D’oh! Stay alert. Katmai’s bears are mostly diurnal (active during the day) but are also active at night and can be found in all of Katmai’s habitats. Never assume you are in a “bear free” area. Be on the lookout for signs of bears and be especially wary in areas where bears may have trouble detecting you. Sometimes, you might see a bear before it is aware of you. In these situations, back away quietly the same way you came and give the bear space.⁣
⁣
The best defense is knowledge, preparation, and prevention. Arm yourself with a knowledge of bear biology, ecology, and behavior. Prepare yourself mentally for bear encounters before you visit Katmai or any park with bears. Learn more tips by visiting the park’s website at nps.gov/katm ⁣
⁣
Image: In the far distance, a bear stands with a paw raised. Be polite and wave back.NPS\R Taylor ⁣
⁣
#awkward #wave #bear #Alaska #katmainationalpark

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by National Park Service in National Mall and Memorial Parks. May be an image of one or more people, monument, outdoors and text.

node.text:
On August 28, 1963, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. delivered his "I Have a Dream" speech from the steps of the Lincoln Memorial. King's speech was the grand finale of the "March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom." His words have endured as one of the signature moments of the civil rights movement.  The location of the podium is marked on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial.
⁣
Image:  The words “I Have a Dream" etched on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial, part of @nationalmallnps.
⁣
#nationalparkservice #lincolnmemorial #mlkjr #ihaveadream #washingtondc
